poem.title: Diaz (for Pietro Cardines)
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
The Colonel's face was usually set to say "bosh"; When he came to the kirk, "The married man lives like a dog", He said to the groom, "And dies like a king; For bachelors, it's the other way round."
So this year the General wed A shipbuilder's widow and wastrel son And they didn't want him for his wit As he had the wit to see, too late, And die, this day, like a dog.
